children.subject: current 61b student and can confirm -- this class is really making me hate cs :(

Well they are at a top CS school and if they do stick with CS their lives will probably be pretty relaxed and they will make a much greater amount of money from their work than people do in most other fields with a large workforce. One class is not really a great reason to make someone go away from that path, they just have to know that how enjoyable a class is often depends on the situation that particular semester.

history.content:
A lot of my friends who are younger than me are taking 61B right now and it's making them "hate CS". My sample size is small but I know 14 close friends who are taking the class and almost all of them have mentioned that their experience (not just because of the logistics, but also because of the very challenging and somewhat dry projects) is making them want to switch majors. These students are also doing well in the class so I don't think they're being salty. I personally never faced this issue when I took the class 3 semesters ago and BYOG still has to be my favorite project of all time. This is making it hard for me to help them when they ask for advice.

Now my question is, how can I explain to them that 61B is not representative of the field and that classes like 170, 188, 189, 161 are truly beautiful and worth pursuing CS for? 

(Don't mean to throw any shade at 61B staff - I know many of y'all personally and know that the TAs and tutors are giving it their all)
history.subject: How to advice students taking 61B about sticking with CS?
